metadata.title: CVE-2017-10663 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The sanity_check_ckpt function in fs/f2fs/super.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.12.4 does not validate the blkoff and segno arrays, which allowslocal users to gain privileges via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-96-generic - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-lowlatency - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-96-generic - 4.4.0-96.119
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1074.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1076-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1076.81
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1031-gke - 4.4.0-1031.31

No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1008-gcp - 4.10.0-1008.8
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1008-gcp - 4.10.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-96.119').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.82').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.81').

linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
